item.title: The IMF anticipates that the Kyrgyz Republic's economy will grow by 2.2% in 2016
item.description: An International Monetary Fund (IMF) team, headed by Edward Gemayel, visited Bishkek, Kyrgyz Republic from July 8th to 14th. The purpose of the visit was to assess the country’s recent economic performance and lay the groundwork for the third review mission under the Extended Credit Facility (ECF), tentatively planned for late September. Preliminary findings from the visit were presented by Gemayel, noting that these do not necessarily reflect the views of the IMFâ€™s Executive Board:
